Hydrogen fuel cells: Hydrogen fuel cells could be used to power vehicles. They generate electricity by combining hydrogen and oxygen, producing only water as a byproduct. This technology is already being used in some vehicles and could be scaled up to meet the demand.
Electric vehicles: Electric vehicles could be powered by rechargeable batteries. They emit no pollution and can be charged using renewable energy sources such as solar or wind power.
Biofuels: Biofuels such as ethanol and biodiesel could be used to power vehicles. They are made from plant-based materials and can be produced using sustainable farming practices.
Nuclear power: Nuclear power could be used to generate electricity to power vehicles. This technology is already being used in some countries and could be scaled up to meet the demand.

Alternative transportation: Alternative transportation methods such as bicycles, electric scooters, and public transportation could be used to replace vehicles. These methods are already being used in some cities and could be promoted to reduce the demand for oil-powered vehicles.
